What should I do if I'm getting the error "Cannot Get a lock on data directory /root/.komodo/VRSC" even though I've stopped the Komodo process?

The error "Cannot Get a lock on data directory /root/.komodo/VRSC" usually means that Komodo is already running. Before trying to start Komodo again, you should check if it's indeed running by using the command `./verus getinfo`. If it's running, you'll get information back, and if it's not, you'll get an error.

# ERROR: Cannot Get a lock on data directory /root/.komodo/VRSC.

Komodo is probably already running.

## Procedure:

It just means you can't start it when it's already running. If it isn't running we can take a look at it.
Check to see if it is running by running:

`./verus getinfo`

If it's running you'll get info back, if it isn't you'll get an error.
If that throws an error, it's worth checking using this command:

`ps fax | grep verus`

and seeing if any processes are listed besides the process you're using to search.
You would see verusd with a child process of komodo and all its cli arguments.

(submitted by @keda666, solution written by englal.vrsc@)

Note: last revision date 2020-02-26.
How do I start Komodo if I get the "Cannot Get a lock on data directory /root/.komodo/VRSC" error?

You can't start Komodo if you're getting the "Cannot Get a lock on data directory /root/.komodo/VRSC" error because it means Komodo is already running. You need to check if it's running using the command `./verus getinfo` or `ps fax | grep verus` and then decide what to do next.

# ERROR: Cannot Get a lock on data directory /root/.komodo/VRSC.

Komodo is probably already running.

## Procedure:

It just means you can't start it when it's already running. If it isn't running we can take a look at it.
Check to see if it is running by running:

`./verus getinfo`

If it's running you'll get info back, if it isn't you'll get an error.
If that throws an error, it's worth checking using this command:

`ps fax | grep verus`

and seeing if any processes are listed besides the process you're using to search.
You would see verusd with a child process of komodo and all its cli arguments.

(submitted by @keda666, solution written by englal.vrsc@)

Note: last revision date 2020-02-26.
What does the error "Cannot Get a lock on data directory /root/.komodo/VRSC" indicate if Komodo is not running?
The error "Cannot Get a lock on data directory /root/.komodo/VRSC" actually indicates that Komodo is already running, not that it's not running. If Komodo is not running, you wouldn't get this error.

# ERROR: Cannot Get a lock on data directory /root/.komodo/VRSC.

Komodo is probably already running.

## Procedure:

It just means you can't start it when it's already running. If it isn't running we can take a look at it.
Check to see if it is running by running:

`./verus getinfo`

If it's running you'll get info back, if it isn't you'll get an error.
If that throws an error, it's worth checking using this command:

`ps fax | grep verus`

and seeing if any processes are listed besides the process you're using to search.
You would see verusd with a child process of komodo and all its cli arguments.

(submitted by @keda666, solution written by englal.vrsc@)

Note: last revision date 2020-02-26.
